qas.question: In what year did Alaskan State Troopers become an official organization?
What is different about a "Public Safety Officer" that distiguishes the position from a policeman?

answers.text: have police training but do not carry firearms

qas.question: What type of vehicles do Troopers operate?

answers.text: a wide variety of land, air, and water patrol vehicles

qas.question: In what year did Alaskan State Troopers become an unofficial organization?
In what year didn't Alaskan State Troopers become an official organization?

plausible_answers.text: have police training but do not carry firearms

qas.question: What is the same about a "Public Safety Officer" that distiguishes the position from a policeman?

plausible_answers.text: a wide variety of land, air, and water patrol vehicles

qas.question: What type of vehicles don't Troopers operate?

context: The Alaska State Troopers are Alaska's statewide police force. They have a long and storied history, but were not an official organization until <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>1941<b5_0/><a0_0/>.<b4_0/> Before the force was officially organized, law enforcement in Alaska was handled by various federal agencies. Larger towns usually have their own local police and some villages rely on "Public Safety Officers" who <a1_0><b6_0>have police training but do not carry firearms<b6_0/><a1_0/>. In much of the state, the troopers serve as the only police force available. In addition to enforcing traffic and criminal law, wildlife Troopers enforce <a2_0><b7_0>hunting and fishing regulations<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Due to the varied terrain and wide scope of the Troopers' duties, they employ <a3_0><b8_0>a wide variety of land, air, and water patrol vehicles<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
